en: My soul is weary of my life; I will give free course to my complaint; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
hmr: “Ka thlâ hin ka hringna hi a nghawk a; Ka nuom tâwkin sawisêl ka tih, Ka lungril rimsiknain thu hril ka tih.

en: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; Show me wherefore thou contendest with me.
hmr: Pathien kuoma chun hieng hin tîng ka ta, Thiemnaw mîn changtir naw la, Keimaa hin ieng ang am i lungawi zâwng a ni mîn entir lem rawh.

en: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, That thou shouldest despise the work of thy hands, And shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
hmr: Nanga ngaiin, i nêksâwr a, I kut sinthawhai chu i hmusit a, Mi rilohai inrâwnna i sukvar chu a ṭha am a nih?

en: Hast thou eyes of flesh? Or seest thou as man seeth?
hmr: Nang chun tisa mithai chu i neiin, Annawleh, i kumhai chu mihriemin an hmu angin i hmu am a nih?

en: Are thy days as the days of man, Or thy years as man’s days,
hmr: I nihai chu mihriemhai nihai ang am an nih? Annawleh, i kumhai chu mihriem kumhai ang am an nih?

en: That thou inquirest after mine iniquity, And searchest after my sin,
hmr: Ka rîtlonahai i sui ngiel a, Ka suolna khawm i zawng rak el chu?

en: Although thou knowest that I am not wicked, And there is none that can deliver out of thy hand?
hmr: Mi rilo ka ni nawh a, I kuta inthawka mi la suok thei tukhawm an um nawh ti hre zing siin?

en: Thy hands have framed me and fashioned me Together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
hmr: I kuthai chun a mi riruongin a mi lo siembâwl vawng tah a, Anachu nangin i mi suksiet el hi.

en: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast fashioned me as clay; And wilt thou bring me into dust again?
hmr: Hi hi hre zing rawh, ka ngên che hi, nang chun pilpawk angin i mi lo siembâwl tah a, Pilvuta bawk i mi ṭhuoi nâwk el ding a ni maw?

en: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, And curdled me like cheese?
hmr: Nang chun nênetui anga mi bunthlain, Nênetui kîng angin i mi hmet ta ni lo am a nih?

en: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, And knit me together with bones and sinews.
hmr: Nang chun vun le taksain i mi lo thuom tah a, Thahruihai le ruhai chun i mi ṭhui khâwm tah.

en: Thou hast granted me life and lovingkindness; And thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
hmr: Hringna le ditsakna i mi lo phalpêk tah a, I vênghimna chun ka thlarau chu a lo hum a.

en: Yet these things thou didst hide in thy heart; I know that this is with thee:
hmr: Amiruokchu, hieng thilhai hi nang chun i lungrila chun i thup a, Hi hi i kuomah a um ti ka hriet a nih.

en: If I sin, then thou markest me, And thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
hmr: Ka lo suol chun, nangin i mîn chik a, Ka khawhlonaa inthawk chun thiem i mîn changtir ngai nawh.

en: If I be wicked, woe unto me; And if I be righteous, yet shall I not lift up my head; Being filled with ignominy, And looking upon mine affliction.
hmr: Mi rilo ka ni chun, ka chung a rik a! Mi fel ni lang khawm ka lu ling naw bawk ka tih, Muolphonain ka sip a, ka tuornahai ka hmu zing leiin.

en: And if my head exalt itself, thou huntest me as a lion; And again thou showest thyself marvellous upon me.
hmr: Ka lu hi ama le ama ân chawimawi chun, sakeibaknei angin i mi pêl a, Ka chunga chun nang chu maktakin i hung inentir a.

en: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, And increasest thine indignation upon me: Changes and warfare are with me.
hmr: Ka chunga chun i thuhretuhai chu i hung sukthar a, Ka chungah i lunginsenna i sukpung a, Mi dotu pâwl dang dang i hung inumtir a.

en: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me.
hmr: Chuong a ni chun iengdinga sula inthawk chun i mi lo lâk suok am a na? Thlarau lo inthla ta lang mitin a mi hmu naw ding bah.

en: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
hmr: Kei chu lo um ta lo ang nîng ka ta, Sula inthawk chun thlânah lâk hmangin lo um tâng ka tih.

en: Are not my days few? cease then, And let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
hmr: Ka nihai a tlâwm hle an nâwm a nih? Tâwp el raw se, Chitêa ka thlamuong dep theina dingin mâkhâtin mîn umtir el rawh.

en: Before I go whence I shall not return, Even to the land of darkness and of the shadow of death;
hmr: Ka hung kîr nâwk nawna dinga ka fe hma hin, Thina hlim le inthimna ram ngeia ka fe hma hin.

en: The land dark as midnight, The land of the shadow of death, without any order, And where the light is as midnight.
hmr: Inthimna ngawta inthim sâmup ram, Thupêk hrim um lo, thina hlim ram; Var khawm inthimna ang nina hmun chu,” tiin.
